docs.snippet: Defying a ban by their new Russian-backed rulers, thousands of Crimean Tatars gathered at a mosque on Sunday to commemorate the day 70 years ago the mass deportation of their families began under the orders of Soviet leader Josef Stalin....

docs.lead_paragraph: In corporate America, L.G.B.T. employees usually remain closeted.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; there are very few openly gay chief executives at nation's 1,000 biggest companies; statistics offer reminder that corporate America is one of the slowest sectors of society to adopt new norms of acceptance of homosexuality, despite fact that it keeps out some talented people.

docs.snippet: Dan Merzel is scheduled to umpire 142 minor league games in a 152-day stretch and be paid $3,000 a month. But he says it is worth it as he pursues his goal to be an umpire in the major leagues....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dan Merzel is scheduled to umpire 142 minor league games in a 152-day stretch and be paid $3,000 a month. But he says it is worth it as he pursues his goal to be an umpire in the major leagues.
docs.abstract: Profile of Dan Merzel, who is working toward his goal to become an umpire in Major League Baseball; Merzel is scheduled to umpire 142 minor league games in a 152-day stretch and be paid $3,000 a month; says it is worth it, even though as a Johns Hopkins graduate with a sought-after degree, he would seem to have more lucrative options.

headline.seo: On the Long Road, Committed to a Goal of Officiating in the Major Leagues
headline.main: Johns Hopkins Graduate, and an Umpire
headline.print_headline: Johns Hopkins Graduate, and an Umpire

docs.snippet: Laredo, Tex., along the Mexican border, where Interstate 35 begins its path, faces extreme challenges to meld two cultures, an evolution occurring in cities and towns nationwide....
docs.lead_paragraph: Laredo, Tex., along the Mexican border, where Interstate 35 begins its path, faces extreme challenges to meld two cultures, an evolution occurring in cities and towns nationwide.
docs.abstract: Majority-Hispanic city of Laredo, Tex, faces daily, difficult effort of melding American and Mexican cultures, local version of evolution occurring in cities and towns nationwide; Laredo's appeal has intensified as Mexicans flee surging violence across the border, drawing immigrants who are testing local confidence, finances and city's bicultural equilibrium (Series: The Way North).

headline.main: Deep Ties, Tested on Mexico’s Border
headline.print_headline: Deep Ties, Tested on Mexico’s Border
